tweets.text: Also, we need to understand fully the pollution impacts of the quarry - not just noise and dust but water quality. Any pollution will run straight into the Blackwater. @EnvAgency should be cleaning up rivers & improving Water Framework Directive status, not worsening situation

And @EnvAgency says "We will continue to be guided by 3 principles in choosing what we do: ‚Ä¢ Put people & wildlife first: our goal is to create a better place for them."  So plant trees, create attenuation ponds, don't quarry right up to medieval Coggeshall.  #sledgehammer

Anyone managing waste outside the law is committing #WasteCrime.

We successfully seized this truck, believed to be involved in waste crime, in a joint operation with the police.

Help us continue our fight by completing the Waste Crime Survey üëá

https://t.co/S6bV2wnn2w https://t.co/qpp8Kf2bcV

Looking forward to chairing the #biomass session at today's  @lowcarbonagri conference. Insights & opinions from @PatriciaThornl4 of @SupergenBioHub , Thomas Wilkins of @NFU_Energy & Dave Bass of @EnvAgency, covering emissions, compliance & a spot of future gazing. #ClimateAction

243 documented violations in 2 years and not a single prosecution. And guess what? Yep, you got it.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/VvjLy78nDI

This is significant. Climate shocks present a material risk to investments. 92% of @EAPensionFund members told us a #netzero target was important. We have been using this framework to help us work out how our portfolio needs to evolve. @EnvAgency @MMMoneyMatter #ClimateAction https://t.co/MUwlEum8OX

@replantavine @MarkourbseBID Bit of a miserable view, Jill. They're saying it's a nice place to live, not proposing to build 10,000 homes on the Water Meadows. Someone moving into an existing home has no additional impact on the local environment. They may even take more care of it than the previous people.

Making hay while the sun shines! Our contractors have got the zinc roof on at Trekeivesteps Gauging Station just ahead of bad weather.

Great to see this one almost complete. Thanks to all involved @DCfieldteamsEA @JamesLockyerLTD and wadebridge scaffold! @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/732UdYqCus

tweets.text: @EnvAgency has done excellent work to identify national natural flood management opportunities.  These work better for Coggeshall because tackle Robins Brook flooding & surface water & Blackwater.  Dam/Quarry only prevents SOME Blackwater flooding. #naturalinstead https://t.co/zvXBikgsq9

Which is why I'm talking to @Essex_CC ; landowners & @EnvAgency to see if a hybrid scheme, either side of the Coggeshall pinch-point, could be considered, to achieve a similar protective result. https://t.co/YfehXJVYGd

Reading @EnvAgency 5 year plan. Nice words e.g. "We will use our voice, our evidence and our action to promote the environment and secure sustainable approaches" - so why not natural flood management on the river Blackwater?  Not 400 acre quarry; 300 m dam https://t.co/xKMxkIT1BO

And...on the one hand you @EnvAgency are doing good stuff to connect fish migration routes (this from @EssexWildlife news) yet simultaneously wanting to block the Blackwater with a 300m wide structure https://t.co/O7gtxywGj2

Only seeing a small increase in river flows following overnight rain and no flood alerts in place @EnvAgencyNW teams have been monitoring overnight as we do 24/7/365 check your risk at https://t.co/jKVsuatlSD https://t.co/DT09BRRCZs

Working with @WestcountryRT and @NESouthWest we have removed Keybridge Weir on the De Lank River, a tributary of the R Camel in north Cornwall, opening up 3k of river for fish.  The weir had been a barrier to fish migration for more than 100 years. #partnership https://t.co/2V0thDWNzO

Thank you to everyone who took part and joined our Floodmobile launch today. You can now access an interactive Floodmobile tour on our website; do please take a look around. We will share a link to the webinar recording & answer all questions posed shortly https://t.co/KB6k5GHoi3 https://t.co/RMKQ40jpi4

Others must know of Tuddenham Mill Stream's wonders; I removed an old fish trap. Met 1 Signal Crayfish regrowing a claw. Swarms of minnows, the dominant fish, many in glorious breeding raiment, their rainbow colours echoing those striping the sand & gravel stream bed #Suffolk 2/3 https://t.co/b87CbdRAvO
